sub_topic: Finding the cross product of two vectors using trigonometry
message_1: Find the cross product of vectors u and v given u = [2, 3, 1] and v = [5, -2, 3].
message_2:
To find the cross product of vectors u and v, we can use the following formula:

u x v = [u2v3 - u3v2, u3v1 - u1v3, u1v2 - u2v1]

where u = [u1, u2, u3] and v = [v1, v2, v3].

Given u = [2, 3, 1] and v = [5, -2, 3], we have:

u1 = 2, u2 = 3, u3 = 1
v1 = 5, v2 = -2, v3 = 3

Now, we can plug these values into the formula:

u x v = [(3)(3) - (1)(-2), (1)(5) - (2)(3), (2)(-2) - (3)(5)]

u x v = [9 + 2, 5 - 6, -4 - 15]

u x v = [11, -1, -19]

So, the cross product of vectors u and v is [11, -1, -19].
